intro.headline: Leeds Fashion Futures
intro.description:
We’re exploring how as a city we can reduce the environmental impact of our clothing choices. 

In partnership with the RSA, we’ve been uncovering Leeds' unique relationship with clothing and textiles, its rich heritage, and the talent, creativity and knowledge that exists now.  From the grassroots groups gathering in communities to share skills, to the mills where world-leading luxury fabrics are created to the young designers committed to working sustainably, there's so much happening here in Leeds. 

What could the future hold? And how do we make it easy for people to make sustainable fashion choices? Find out what we're doing as part of #LeedsFashionFutures.

hire.title:
Need help? 
 Hire us!
hire.description:
Our expertise lies in developing behaviour change campaigns that help people and organisations to waste less.

Are you interested in us working with you? 

We have a strong track record for developing engaging, impactful campaigns that create change.  Our 10 week #stayathome waste reduction campaign - developed at the start of lockdown in March and delivered for Leeds City Council - is the latest example of this.  You can read our impact report [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/19LPgf0gzOOzYTYmitXUZje8d2BwdeAXG/view).

projects.title: School uniform re-use
projects.description: We want to make second-hand school uniform first choice in Leeds.  Our Leeds School Uniform Exchange project is supporting people across the city to swap uniform at their school or in their local community.

projects.title: Glass recycling
projects.description: Glass recycling increased by 37% in Leeds last year!  We want to build on that success.  Join our campaign to find out what happens to your glass after it goes in the bank, why it's important to recycle it, and plenty of top tips including a map of your nearest glass bank.
